definition: to pay respects to the dead/to mark sb's passing
Ai (c. 2000 BC), sixth of legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Li 釐|厘[Li2]
sorrow/grief/pity/to grieve for/to pity/to lament/to condole

sentences.english: Flags were at half mast everywhere on the day of mourning for victims of Wenchuan earthquake.
sentences.chinese: 例句汶川地震哀悼日全國降半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: Following the  placement of the wreath, the marines will lower the flag to half staff.
sentences.chinese: 在敬獻花圈後，美國海軍陸戰隊員將降半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: National flags flew at half-mast in public places, at Chinese embassies and at consulates.
sentences.chinese: 全國和駐外使領館下半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: All the flags were at half-mast when the king died.
sentences.chinese: 國王駕崩，全國都下半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: Following the placement of the wreath, the marines will lower the flag to half staff.
sentences.chinese: 在敬獻花圈後，美國水師陸戰隊員將下半旗誌哀。

sentences.english: Following the placement of the wreath, the marines will lower the flag to half staff .
sentences.chinese: 在敬獻花圈後，美國海軍陸戰隊員將降半旗誌哀。
